prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Begin by creating a new coordinate system. For part 1, set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0038, 0.0]. This will position and orient your sketch plane correctly. Next, create a 2D sketch on the specified coordinate system. Start by creating the first face (face_1) using the information provided in the "sketch" section. Within face_1, create the first loop (loop_1) consisting of four lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, and line_4). Here, line_1 extends from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0], line_2 extends from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.225], line_3 extends from point [0.75, 0.225] to point [0.0, 0.225], and line_4 extends from point [0.0, 0.225] back to point [0.0, 0.0]. Make sure the loop is closed as specified in the instructions. After sketching, scale the 2D sketch using a factor of 0.75 as listed in the "extrusion" section of part 1. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and the translation vector present in the coordinate system. Now extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. In the "extrusion" section of part 1, set the extrude_depth_towards_normal to 0.0038 and the sketch_scale to 0.75. Keep the extrude_depth_opposite_normal to 0.0 since it is not required in this specific part. Since this is the first part, create a new solid body using the described boolean operation. Although the JSON specifies "NewBodyFeatureOperation", you should use the natural language description: *Adding material to create a new solid body*. The final dimensions of this rectangular prism will be 0.75 units in width, 0.0037 units in height, and 0.75 units in length.</description>
